questions.question: If bar magnet hung by thread at center, north pole points to?
Iron filings stick most to which part of magnet?
To separate iron from mixture of sand, paper, sawdust, pins?
In experiment, iron bar acquires magnetism when?
For finding direction in forest, use?
For window shutter that opens/shuts in wind, use?
If magnet cut at two places perpendicular to axis, how many magnets formed?
Total poles formed when bar magnet cut at two places?
When magnetic material near magnet, it acquires?
A magnet remains steady in which direction?
Define a magnet.
questions.answer: The material to which objects made from iron, nickel, cobalt, etc. get attracted is called a magnet.

questions.question: What is magnetism?
questions.answer: This property of a material attracting iron, nickel, cobalt objects is called magnetism.

questions.question: Who is Magnes?
questions.answer: A shepherd named Magnes from Greece in the legend of magnet discovery.

questions.question: Why did Magnes' shoes and staff stick to the rock?
questions.answer: Because of the iron nails in his shoes and iron ferrule on his staff attracted by magnetite.

questions.question: What are lodestones?
questions.answer: Magnetite rocks used for finding directions, also called leading stones.

questions.question: List shapes of everyday magnets.
questions.answer: Bar magnets, disc magnets, horseshoe magnets, ring-shaped magnets, cylindrical magnets, button magnets.

questions.question: Why is magnetism a kind of energy?
questions.answer: When a magnet attracts an object, the object is displaced due to magnetic force; work is done by magnetic force.

questions.question: Where are magnetic cranes used?
questions.answer: Factories, ports, garbage depots to shift large objects.

questions.question: Define north pole of a magnet.
questions.answer: The end that points to the north, indicated by N.

questions.question: Define south pole of a magnet.
questions.answer: The end that points to the south, indicated by S.

questions.question: How does a suspended magnet behave?
questions.answer: A magnet always settles in the north-south direction.

questions.question: Where do most iron filings stick on a magnet?
What happens when magnet is cut into two?
What is induced magnetism?
questions.answer: A magnetic material acquires magnetism when placed near a magnet.

questions.question: Describe like poles interaction.
questions.answer: There is repulsion between like poles of a magnet.

questions.question: Describe opposite poles interaction.
questions.answer: There is attraction between opposite poles.

questions.question: How to make temporary magnet?
questions.answer: Rub a needle or nail with a magnet from one end to the other 7-8 times.

questions.question: Apparatus for electromagnet.
questions.answer: Iron nail 10 cm, 1-metre insulated copper wire, battery cell.

questions.question: How to assemble electromagnet?
questions.answer: Wind copper wire around nail, join ends to cell.

questions.question: What is an electromagnet?
questions.answer: Magnetism produced in nail due to electric current; temporary.

questions.question: What is maglev train?
questions.answer: Train using repulsion between magnets on train and rail for high speed without friction.

questions.question: Permanent magnets example.
questions.answer: Magnets in pin holder or cupboard door.

questions.question: Michael Faraday's contribution.
questions.answer: Developed technique of producing electricity with help of a magnet.

questions.question: How magnetism is destroyed.
questions.answer: When magnet is heated, thrown, knocked about or broken into pieces.

questions.question: What is magnet keeper?
questions.answer: A bar of soft or pure iron placed in the box to protect the magnet.

questions.question: Data storage using magnets.
questions.answer: Strip of magnetic material in ATM cards, credit cards; hard disk of computer, audio/video tape.

questions.question: How to determine if material is magnetic.
questions.answer: Bring a magnet near it; if it sticks, magnetic.

questions.question: Why use magnet for iron from trash.
questions.answer: Iron sticks to magnet, can be separated.

questions.question: North pole steady direction.
questions.answer: North pole becomes steady in the direction of the south pole of the earth.

questions.question: If magnet attracts metal, what is metal?
Maglev train magnets help.
questions.answer: Magnets fixed on two sides of train help it move forward.

questions.question: Faraday's early life.
questions.answer: Born in poor family, worked with bookseller, read many books, developed interest in science.

questions.question: Significance of Faraday's research.
questions.answer: We can use electricity and electromagnetism in innumerable instruments today.

questions.question: Why store magnets carefully.
questions.answer: Magnetism gets destroyed if heated, thrown, knocked or broken.

questions.question: Iron filings behavior in induced magnetism.
questions.answer: Stick to iron bar when magnet near, fall off when magnet taken away.

questions.question: What we have learnt: magnetic metals.
questions.answer: Iron, nickel, cobalt are magnetic metals.

questions.question: Explain pin holder mechanism.
questions.answer: Magnet fitted in cap; iron pins stick to it.

questions.question: Fridge door magnet role.
questions.answer: Closes automatically; does not open unless pulled.

questions.question: Classify objects using magnet.
questions.answer: Those which stick: magnetic; do not: non-magnetic.

questions.question: Mixture separation with magnet.
questions.answer: Iron filings and pins stick to magnet.

questions.question: Origin of name magnet.
questions.answer: From shepherd Magnes or Magnesia in Greece.

questions.question: Early use of magnets.
questions.answer: In China and Europe for finding directions.

questions.question: Magnetic power example.
questions.answer: Cranes shift large objects using magnetic force.

questions.question: Suspended magnet experiment.
questions.answer: Tie thread to center, hangs from stand, settles north-south.

questions.question: Iron filings experiment conclusion.
questions.answer: Fewer filings in center; most at poles.

questions.question: Cutting magnet experiment.
questions.answer: Each piece has two poles; independent magnets.

questions.question: Induced magnetism experiment.
questions.answer: Iron bar below magnet gets filings; vanish when magnet removed.

questions.question: Electromagnet fun activity.
questions.answer: Pins stick to nail head when current on.

questions.question: Why pins fall off in electromagnet.
Permanent vs temporary magnets.
questions.answer: Pin holder permanent; crane electromagnet temporary.

questions.question: Faraday's background.
questions.answer: Poor family, bookseller job led to science interest.

questions.question: Storing magnets precaution.
questions.answer: Use keeper to prevent destruction of magnetism.

questions.question: Magnetic storage devices.
questions.answer: ATM/credit cards, computer hard disk, tapes.

questions.question: To find north pole of magnet.
questions.answer: Suspend freely; end pointing north is N.

questions.question: How electromagnet made.
questions.answer: Wind insulated copper wire on iron nail, connect to battery.

questions.question: Properties of magnet.
questions.answer: Settles N-S, poles attract iron filings, poles inseparable, like repel unlike attract.

questions.question: Practical uses of magnet.
questions.answer: Pin holder, fridge, crane, doorbell, compass, data storage.

questions.question: Natural vs man-made magnets.
questions.answer: Magnetite natural; bar, horseshoe etc. man-made.

questions.question: Rubbing method significance.
questions.answer: Makes magnetic objects acquire temporary magnetism.

questions.question: Earth pole relation.
questions.answer: Magnet N points to earth geographic S.

questions.question: Pole separation impossibility reason.
questions.answer: Each piece forms complete magnet with two poles.

questions.question: Experiment to show magnetic field.
questions.answer: Iron filings pattern on paper over magnet.

questions.question: Why pins don't fall in pin holder.
questions.answer: Stick to magnet even upside down.

questions.question: To become scientist.
questions.answer: Read stories, try activities, ponder experiences.

questions.question: What we learnt summary.
questions.answer: Magnets align N-S, poles key, inseparable, used daily via electromagnetism.
